column2: [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] wrote '''[[Letters not published in "The Letters of J.R.R. Tolkien"|a letter]] to Mr S.E.O. Joukes''' (apparently a native of the Netherlands<ref>[[Ren√© van Rossenberg]]
column3: ''[[Hobbits in Holland|Hobbits in Holland: Leven en werk van JRR Tolkien (1892-1973)]]''

column1: *'''Contents:''' Mr. Joukes wants to name his daughter ''[[Ioreth]]''
column2: but Tolkien writes that it means 'old woman' in Elvish (Tolkien also notes that the name probably does not occur outside ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''). Furthermore
column3: Tolkien writes about the translation of the name ''[[Arwen]]''.<ref>{{CG|C}}

column1: *'''Publication:''' ''[[Hobbits in Holland|Hobbits in Holland: Leven en werk van JRR Tolkien (1892-1973)]]''. An excerpt was also published in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion]]'' (p. 68).
[''Arwen''] means in Elvish 'noble maiden', but ... it is also a word in [[Welsh]] meaning 'greatly blessed'
